STAdata.Name: Climate variables
STAdata.Description: Consistent climate data from across elevational gradients
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Air temperature, wind-speed, SWE, species presence
STAdata.Reason partial matching: Limited the coverage of all variables, limited access to in-situ data due to policies of governments in different countries, lack of standards (many different formats)

STAdata.Name: Harmonize in-situ data
STAdata.Description: Harmonize in-situ data for crop land or crop type mapping
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Phenology, stage of the crop, crop management (e.g., irrigation)
STAdata.Reason partial matching: No well-searchable, no cloud service (only downloadble through zenodo)

STAdata.Name: SOC stocks in the topsoil (to 30 cm depth)
STAdata.Description: SOC stocks in the topsoil (to 30 cm depth)
STAdata.Coordinated measure: land management for carbon change factors
STAdata.Reason partial matching: No updatable, methods can be improved

STAdata.Name: Fish consumption
STAdata.Description: Presence of mercury in fish consumption

STAdata.Reason partial matching: Lacks information about the origin (the location) of the fish

STAdata.Coordinated measure: Precipitation, Temperature

STAdata.Name: Water quality and quantity data in Estonia, Europe, Globe
STAdata.Description: Every possible kind of continues of discontinues water quality and quantity datasets
STAdata.Variable name: Nutrients, dissolved oxygen, DOC, Chl, water temperature, temperature profiles, pCO2, global irradiance, wind, humidity, flow rates, land cover and its changes, ect
STAdata.Partial matching dataset: There are many available through the data providers, but almost nothing openly available for downloading. At the same time, many parameters should not be also shared without additional knowledge about the studied systems
STAdata.Reason partial matching: Never not enough data available

STAdata.Name: Species tree per city
STAdata.Description: The tree species information provides valuable elements for the toxicity, nativeness or invasiveness of a species. Gathering all this information can be beneficial for local authorities to develop current and future strategies and action plans.
STAdata.Reason partial matching: Not all species are recorded, city is partially mapped.

STAdata.Name: Physical water parameters
STAdata.Description: Longer insitu data and models
STAdata.Reason partial matching: We use it but need more data and resolution

STAdata.Name: Tree damaging / vitality loss events around Europe

STAdata.Name: Post-fire in situ assessment and documention of affected assets
STAdata.Description: In Mediterranean countries (e.g. Greece, Italy, Spain) a detailed questionnaire/form is filled in by the competent authorities (e.g. fire brigade in Greece, Cabinieri Forestiali in Italy) that documents in detail. Only aggregates of this bottom-up work reaches the annual EFFIS reports. Additionally, JRC has set minimum requirements for the required information in 2014 â€œThe European Fire Database Technical specifications and data submissionâ€. The Mediterranean countries go well beyond this and could substantially inform the losses and damages domain.
STAdata.Variable name: Impacted assets include including fatalities, injuries, type of timber affected, livestock, primary or secondary production businesses. From the EBVs:Primary productivity, Ecosystem disturbances
STAdata.Reason partial matching: EFFIS just receives the aggregated values of the reporting based on this kind of forms. Losses and damages, especially indirect losses necessitate the actual raw information

STAdata.Name: Profiling of individual fatalities
STAdata.Description: Recorded circumstances of individual deaths resulting from flood
STAdata.Variable name: ECV: River discharge, Victim: age, gender, residency, condition, activity, place, dynamiscs, cause, behavior, hazardous behavior
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Victim: age, gender, residency, condition, activity, place, dynamics, cause, behavior, hazardous behavior
STAdata.Reason partial matching: Missing countries, missing years, missing detail

STAdata.Name: Database for recording climate-related damages on cultural heritage
STAdata.Description: Several policies require such information, not least the Sendai-related reporting. These is no standardized way for reporting such information with the added challenge being the measuring of cultural value and consequent damage. The DALIH database aims at providing a uniform way of doing so with local input (from a competent authority or even citizen science) being a prerequisite). It can also be utilized for impact modelling validation
STAdata.Variable name: ECV: Extreme weather events and cultural heritage asset-level documentation of damage and cost estimate
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Variables regarding the extreme weather events that affected the cultural heritage asset
STAdata.Reason partial matching: The website is currently unavailable. Climate related impacts are scarce, especially in Europe. This is a structured database that needs input from competent authorities

STAdata.Name: Post-fire in situ assessment and documention of affected assets
STAdata.Description: In Mediterranean countries (e.g. Greece, Italy, Spain) a detailed questionnaire/form is filled in by the competent authorities (e.g. fire brigade in Greece, Cabinieri Forestiali in Italy) that documents in detail. Only aggregates of this bottom-up work reaches the annual EFFIS reports. Additionally, JRC has set minimum requirements for the required information in 2014 â€œThe European Fire Database Technical specifications and data submissionâ€. The Mediterranean countries go well beyond this and could substantially inform the losses and damages domain.
STAdata.Variable name: Impacted assets include including fatalities, injuries, type of timber affected, livestock, primary or secondary production businesses. From the EBVs:Primary productivity, Ecosystem disturbances
STAdata.Reason partial matching: EFFIS just receives the aggregated values of the reporting based on this kind of forms. Losses and damages, especially indirect losses necessitate the actual raw information

STAdata.Name: Profiling of individual fatalities
STAdata.Description: Recorded circumstances of individual deaths resulting from flood
STAdata.Variable name: ECV: River discharge, Victim: age, gender, residency, condition, activity, place, dynamiscs, cause, behavior, hazardous behavior
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Victim: age, gender, residency, condition, activity, place, dynamics, cause, behavior, hazardous behavior
STAdata.Reason partial matching: Missing countries, missing years, missing detail

STAdata.Name: Database for recording climate-related damages on cultural heritage
STAdata.Description: Several policies require such information, not least the Sendai-related reporting. These is no standardized way for reporting such information with the added challenge being the measuring of cultural value and consequent damage. The DALIH database aims at providing a uniform way of doing so with local input (from a competent authority or even citizen science) being a prerequisite). It can also be utilized for impact modelling validation
STAdata.Variable name: ECV: Extreme weather events and cultural heritage asset-level documentation of damage and cost estimate
STAdata.Coordinated measure: Variables regarding the extreme weather events that affected the cultural heritage asset
STAdata.Reason partial matching: The website is currently unavailable. Climate related impacts are scarce, especially in Europe. This is a structured database that needs input from competent authorities
